subject: RE: [junit] DataBase Testing
msgSnippet: Hello. What about testing over a TEST DB which it s state is always known. Each test that runs, ROLLBACK the changes made. Meaning - testing the insert method
messageBody:
Hello.
What about testing over a TEST DB which it's state is always known.
Each test that runs, ROLLBACK the changes made.
Meaning - testing the insert method for instance, will not change the state of the DB.
This way, i always know the state of the DB, and i dont have to build a complicated fixture to run a test
that checks how many rows i have in Emp table for example.
Please tell me what you think about it.
Tamir Salomon.

-----Original Message-----
From: vivek srinivasan [mailto:wvuvivek@...]
Sent: ×“ 13/11/2002 22:09
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Cc:
Subject: [junit] DataBase Testing



Hi Junitians,
Thx for all the time and help in all my previous
queries.This is question i have for a database unit
testing.
I have created a table called FlightInfo and stored
data into it. What i need is to write a testcase to
check for a null condition.ie if a null value is
inserted into the database, it should "spit" out that
error!!
I am sending a fragment of code i have written.
Thanks again for your time and help.
Vivek


public static void StoreData()
{
try
{
st.executeUpdate("Insert into FlightInfo values
(434,'Boeing707','JFK','PIT',200,30,300)");
st.executeUpdate("Insert into FlightInfo values
(13,'Boeing','DULL','LAX',30,30,400)");
st.executeUpdate("Insert into FlightInfo values
(113,'Boeing','JFK','LAX',null,10,100)");
conn.close();
}
catch(Exception t)
{
t.printStackTrace();
}
}
public static void CreateTables()
{
try
{
String createfi="Create Table FlightInfo (FlightNo
number PRIMARY KEY, AirlineName varchar(50),Source
varchar(50),Destination varchar(50),TotalSeats
number,AvailableSeats number,Cost number)";
st.executeUpdate(createfi);
}
catch(Exception t)
{
t.printStackTrace();
}
}
